tit.cmt: Changed to "Porridge" because the article pertains to all varieties of porridge, not just Japanese kayu.
チェッカーさんのご指摘も最もだと思いましたが、全体的にはやはり日本の粥の説明が多いようですので、ここではKayu をタイトルにしました。

sen.j: 粥（かゆ）は、米（粳米）、アワ、ソバなどの穀類や豆類、芋類などを多目の水で柔らかく煮た料理。
sen.e: Kayu is a dish made by boiling grains such as rice seeds, foxtail millet and buckwheat, beans or potatoes in lots of water until they are soft.
sen.cmt: 原文に「粥」とある場合、訳文には kayu としておきました。
sen.e: Porridge is a dish made by boiling grains such as rice seeds, foxtail millet and buckwheat, beans or potatoes in a large quantity of water until they become soft.
Kayu (porridge) is a dish made by boiling grains such as rice seeds, foxtail millet and buckwheat, beans or potatoes in a large quantity of water until they become soft.
sen.cmt: 日本の粥の説明として、Kayu (porridge) としました。

sen.j: 高齢者を中心に「お粥さん」と呼ぶ者も多い。
sen.e: Many elderly people call it 'okayu-san.'
Many elderly people call it 'okayu-san.'
Many elderly people call it 'okayu-san.'

sen.j: 粥の上澄み液を重湯（おもゆ）という。
sen.e: The clear liquid on top of the kayu is called omoyu (thin rice gruel).
The clear liquid on top of kayu (congee, or rice porridge) is called omoyu (rice water).
sen.cmt: Deleted "the"Added "(congee, or rice porridge)""thin rice gruel" > "rice water"
sen.e: The clear liquid on top of kayu is called omoyu (rice water).
sen.cmt: 粥 の英訳をここでは削除しました。

sen.j: 穀類、水、熱源と鍋ひとつがあれば簡単に調理できる料理である。
sen.e: It is a dish that can be cooked easily if one has grains, water, a source of heat and a single pot.
It is a dish that can be cooked easily if one has grains, water, a source of heat and a single pot.
Kayu is a dish that can be cooked easily if one has grains, water, a source of heat and a single pot.
sen.cmt: 日本の粥の説明ですので、kayu としました。

sen.j: 粥は消化が良く、体も温まるため、胃腸が弱っている時や風邪などの病気の際に食べる事が多い。
sen.e: Kayu is easy to digest and warms the body.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kayu is easy to digest and warms the body.
It is easy to digest and warms the body, so it is often eaten when suffering from conditions affecting the stomach or intestines, or from an illness such as a cold.
sen.cmt: 次セルと統合しました。

sen.j: また、離乳食としても用いられる。
sen.e: It is also used as a baby food.
It is also used as a baby food.
It is also used as a baby food.

sen.j: 精進料理の主食としても欠かせない。
sen.e: It is an essential item as the main staple of shojin ryori (vegetarian cuisine).
It is essential as a main staple of shojin ryori (vegetarian cuisine originally derived from the dietary restrictions of Buddhist monks).
sen.cmt: Deleted "an"Deleted "item""the" > "a"Added "originally derived from the dietry restrictions of Buddhist monks"
sen.e: It is essential as a main staple of shojin ryori (vegetarian cuisine originally derived from the dietary restrictions of Buddhist monks).

sen.j: 朝食に食べる人も少なくなく、ホテルのレストランなどでも朝食に出す場合がある。
sen.e: More than just a few people eat it for breakfast, and in some cases it is served for breakfast at hotel restaurants.
A not insignificant number of people eat it for breakfast, and it is sometimes served for breakfast at hotel restaurants.
sen.cmt: "More than just a few" > "A not insignificant number of""in some case it is" > "it is sometimes"
sen.e: A not insignificant number of people eat it for breakfast, and it is sometimes served for breakfast at hotel restaurants.

sen.j: 日本以外もシンガポール、マレーシア、タイ王国など東南アジアでも一般的な食事である。
sen.e: Other than Japan, it is also a common dish for meals in Southeast Asia, such as in Singapore, Malaysia and the Kingdom of Thai.
Other than Japan, it is also commonly eaten in Southeast Asian countries including Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand.
sen.cmt: "a common dish for meals" > "commonly eaten""Southeast Asia, such as in" > "Southeast Asian countries including""the Kingdom of Thai" > "Thailand"
sen.e: Other than Japan, porridge is also commonly eaten in Southeast Asian countries including Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand.
sen.cmt: ここからは日本の粥ではなく、一般的な粥ですので、porridge としました。

sen.j: また、中華人民共和国や朝鮮半島などアジアだけではなくヨーロッパやアフリカにも粥がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, besides Asia, such as the People's Republic of China and the Korean Peninsula, it can also be found in Europe and Africa.
It is found not only in Asian countries such the People's Republic of China and the Korean peninsula but also in Europe and Africa.
It is found not only in Asian countries such the People's Republic of China and the Korean peninsula but also in Europe and Africa.

sen.j: フランスのブルターニュ地方では古くからそば粥が庶民の常食とされていた。
sen.e: In the Brittany region of France, buckwheat porridge has been the common people's regular diet since the olden days.
In the French region of Brittany, buckwheat porridge has been a staple food of the common people since ancient times.
In the French region of Brittany, buckwheat porridge has been a staple food of the common people since ancient times.

sen.j: 中欧や北欧では、最も量の多い食事を昼に食べる習慣があると夕食は粥で軽く済ませることも多い。
sen.e: In the central and northern Europe, where there is a custom of eating the largest meal at lunch time, often times porridge is served as a light supper.
In the central and northern Europe, where there is a custom of eating the largest meal of the day at lunchtime, congee is often served as a light supper.
sen.cmt: Added "of the day""lunch time" > "lunchtime""often times porridge is" > "congee is often"
sen.e: In the central and northern Europe, where there is a custom of eating the largest meal of the day at lunchtime, congee is often served as a light supper.

sen.j: ドイツでは、オートミール、ソバ、米、セモリナなどの粥を穀物のスープと呼び、バター、砂糖、シナモン、レーズン、果物のコンポート、種実類などを加えて食べる。
sen.e: In Germany, porridges made of oatmeal, buckwheat, rice and semolina are called grain soups, and they are eaten by adding butter, sugar, cinnamon, raisins, fruit compotes and nuts.
In Germany, congees made of oatmeal, buckwheat, rice and semolina are called grain soups, and they are eaten by adding butter, sugar, cinnamon, raisins, fruit compotes and nuts.
In Germany, congees made of oatmeal, buckwheat, rice and semolina are called grain soups, and they are eaten by adding butter, sugar, cinnamon, raisins, fruit compotes and nuts.

sen.j: ロシアにもカーシャという粥がある。
sen.e: In Russia, there is a kayu called kasha.
In Russia, there is a type of porridge called kasha.
In Russia, there is a type of porridge called kasha.

sen.j: 砂糖を入れて甘く作った牛乳粥は南アジア、西アジア、中近東、ヨーロッパ、北アフリカにかけての広い地域で見られる。
sen.e: Milk kayu, made sweet by adding sugar, can be found in a large range of areas from South Asia, West Asia, the Middle East, Europe and to Northern Africa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Milk porridge, sweetened by adding sugar, can be found in a wide range of areas including South Asia, West Asia, the Middle East, Europe and North Africa.
Milk porridge, sweetened by adding sugar, can be found in a wide range of areas including South Asia, West Asia, the Middle East, Europe and North Africa.

sen.j: 例えばスペイン語圏の各国では「アロス・コン・レチェ」として、主に子どもが喜ぶおやつとしてよく食べられている。
sen.e: For example, in Spanish-speaking countries, it is served as 'arroz con leche,' and it is often eaten as a snack favored mainly by children.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For example, in Spanish-speaking countries, it is served as 'arroz con leche,' and it is often eaten as a snack favored mainly by children.
For example, in Spanish-speaking countries, it is served as 'arroz con leche,' and it is often eaten as a snack favored mainly by children.

sen.j: 粥の水分を少なくすればプディング、多くすればスープに近くなる。
sen.e: If the amount of water is decreased a kayu becomes a pudding, and if it is increased it becomes closer to a soup.
If the water content is reduced, a porridge becomes a pudding, and if it is increased it becomes closer to a soup.
If the water content is reduced, a porridge becomes a pudding, and if it is increased it becomes closer to a soup.

sen.j: 江戸時代に引越し蕎麦の風習が始まるまでは、引越しの際には粥を近所に配っていた。
sen.e: Kayu was distributed to the neighbors upon moving until the custom of distributing buckwheat noodles upon moving began during the Edo period.
Until the custom of giving out soba to new neighbours after a house move (hikkoshi soba) began during the Edo period, people would distribute kayu after moving.
In Japan, until the custom of giving out soba to new neighbors after a house move (hikkoshi soba) began during the Edo period, people would distribute kayu after moving.
sen.cmt: ここでは日本の粥の説明に変わりますので、In Japan を補足しました。

tit.e: Classification based on the cooking method
Classification based on the cooking method
Classification based on the cooking method

sen.j: 入れ粥
sen.e: Iregayu
Iregayu
Iregayu

sen.j: 一度通常の水分量で炊いたご飯を使う粥。
sen.e: This is a kayu that uses rice that has been cooked once in the usual amount of water.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is a kayu made by first cooking rice in the usual amount of water.
This is a kayu made by first cooking rice in the usual amount of water.

sen.j: ご飯の倍程度の量の白湯を加えて炊きなおして作る。
sen.e: The rice is cooked again in twice the amount of plain hot water as the rice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The rice is then cooked again in twice the volume of boiled water to rice.
The rice is then cooked again in twice the volume of boiled water to rice.

sen.j: 余りご飯を粥にして食べる場合などの調理法である。
sen.e: This is a cooking method used for eating left-over rice as a kayu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is a cooking method use to prepare kayu from leftover rice.
This is a cooking method use to prepare kayu from leftover rice.

sen.j: 易しく作れるがおねば（粘り気のある汁）が出易く、炊き粥にくらべると味が落ちる。
sen.e: It is easy to make but it tends to produce more oneba (soluble solids of cooked rice), and compared to takigayu (cooked thin rice porridge) it is not as flavorful.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is easy to make but it tends to produce more oneba (sticky paste), and it is not as flavorful compared to takigayu (cooked thin rice porridge).
sen.cmt: "soluble solids of cooked rice" > "sticky paste"Moved " it is not as flavorful"
sen.e: It is easy to make but it tends to produce more oneba (sticky paste), and it is not as flavorful compared to takigayu (cooked thin rice porridge).

sen.j: 炊き粥
sen.e: Takigayu
Takigayu
Takigayu

sen.j: 生米から炊いて作る粥で、米と水の分量比により呼称が異なる。
sen.e: This is a kayu made by cooking uncooked rice, and there are different names based on the ratio of rice and water.
This is a kayu made by cooking uncooked rice, and there are different names depending on the ratio of rice to water.
This is a kayu made by cooking uncooked rice, and there are different names depending on the ratio of rice to water.

sen.j: 後述する茶粥の場合はかき混ぜても米が崩れにくい。
sen.e: In the case of chagayu (tea porridge) mentioned later the rice tends not to break apart even when stirred.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the case of chagayu (tea porridge) mentioned later the rice tends not to break apart even when stirred.
In the case of chagayu (tea porridge) mentioned later the rice tends not to break apart even when stirred.

sen.j: しかし、白粥の場合は炊くときにかき混ぜると米が崩れ、おねばが出て味が落ちる。
sen.e: However, in shirogayu (white rice porridge), stirring makes the grains of rice fall apart, producing oneba and making the kayu less flavorful.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in shirogayu (white rice porridge), stirring makes the grains of rice fall apart, producing oneba and making the kayu less flavorful.
However, in shirogayu (white rice porridge), stirring makes the grains of rice fall apart, producing oneba and making the kayu less flavorful.

sen.j: したがって、あまりかき混ぜない方がよい。
sen.e: Therefore, it is preferable not to stir it very much.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is preferable not to stir it very much.
Therefore, it is preferable not to stir it very much.

sen.j: 吹きこぼれない程度の強火で、米が自然に対流するように炊くのが良いといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that the rice should be cooked over high heat, allowing the grains of rice to dance naturally, but without the liquid boiling over the pot.
It is said that the rice should be cooked over a high heat, allowing the grains of rice to move naturally, but without the liquid boiling over.
It is said that the rice should be cooked over a high heat, allowing the grains of rice to move naturally, but without the liquid boiling over.

tit.e: Classification based on the amount of water
Classification based on the amount of water
Classification based on the amount of water

sen.j: （注：同じ呼称でも米と水の分量比が異なったものが複数存在するようである。詳しい人による詳細を希望）
sen.e: (note: It seems that there are many kayu dishes made with different ratios of rice and water even when they have the same name. Looking for detailed explanation by people who have a thorough knowledge of kayu.)

Note: It seems that there are many kayu dishes made with different ratios of rice to water even when they have the same name. Looking for detailed explanation by people who have a thorough knowledge of kayu.

Note: It seems that there are many kayu dishes made with different ratios of rice to water even when they have the same name. Looking for detailed explanation by people who have a thorough knowledge of kayu.

sen.e: Zengayu
Zengayu
Zengayu

sen.j: 米の5倍量の水で炊く。
sen.e: Kayu cooked with water five times the amount of rice.
Kayu cooked using five times the amount of water to rice.
Kayu cooked using five times the amount of water to rice.

sen.j: 七分粥
sen.e: Shichibugayu
Shichibugayu
Shichibugayu

sen.j: 米の7倍量の水で炊く。
sen.e: Kayu cooked with water seven times the amount of rice.
Kayu cooked using seven times the amount of water to rice.
Kayu cooked using seven times the amount of water to rice.

sen.j: 五分粥
sen.e: Gobugayu
Gobugayu
Gobugayu

sen.j: 米の10倍量の水で炊く。
sen.e: Kayu cooked with water ten times the amount of rice.
Kayu cooked using ten times the amount of water to rice.
Kayu cooked using ten times the amount of water to rice.

sen.j: 三分粥
sen.e: Sanbugayu
Sanbugayu
Sanbugayu

sen.j: 米の20倍量の水で炊く。
sen.e: Kayu cooked with water 20 times the amount of rice.
Kayu cooked using twenty times the amount of water to rice.
Kayu cooked using twenty times the amount of water to rice.

tit.j: 具や味付けによる分類
tit.e: Classification based on the seasonings and the ingredients
Classification based on ingredients and seasoning
Classification based on ingredients and seasoning

sen.j: 白粥（しらがゆ）
sen.e: Shiragayu
Shiragayu
Shiragayu

sen.j: 米を水で炊くだけで、具を入れていないもの。
sen.e: This is made by boiling rice in water without any other ingredients.
Made by boiling rice in water without any other ingredients.
Made by boiling rice in water without any other ingredients.

sen.j: 味も付けないことが多いが、少量の塩を加える場合がある。
sen.e: Often times no seasonings are used, but sometimes a small amount of salt is added.
It is common for no seasoning to be used but sometimes a small amount of salt is added.
It is common for no seasoning to be used but sometimes a small amount of salt is added.

sen.j: 漬け物、梅干し、塩辛、しらす乾し、佃煮、落花生など、さまざまなものを付け合わせに食べる事が多い。
sen.e: It is often eaten with various toppings such as tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables), umeboshi (pickled plums), shiokara (salted fish guts), shirasuboshi (dried young sardines), tsukudani (various ingredients such as seafood and seaweed cooked in sweetened soy sauce) and peanuts.

It is often eaten with various toppings such as tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables), umeboshi (pickled plums), shiokara (salted fish entrails), shirasuboshi (dried young sardines), tsukudani (various ingredients such as seafood and seaweed cooked in sweetened soy sauce) and peanuts.

It is often eaten with various toppings such as tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables), umeboshi (pickled plums), shiokara (salted fish entrails), shirasuboshi (dried young sardines), tsukudani (various ingredients such as seafood and seaweed cooked in sweetened soy sauce) and peanuts.

sen.j: 黒米粥（くろまいがゆ）
sen.e: Kuromaigayu
Kuromaigayu
Kuromaigayu

sen.j: 黒米を水で炊いたもの。
sen.e: This is made by boiling black rice.
Made by boiling black rice.
Made by boiling black rice.

sen.j: 茶粥（ちゃがゆ）
sen.e: Chagayu
Chagayu
Chagayu

sen.j: 米をほうじ茶で炊いたもの。
sen.e: This is made by boiling rice in hojicha tea (roasted green tea).
Made by boiling rice in hojicha tea (roasted green tea).
Made by boiling rice in hojicha tea (roasted green tea).

sen.j: 牛乳粥（ぎゅうにゅうがゆ）、ミルク粥（ミルクがゆ）
sen.e: Gyunyugayu, milk gayu (milk porridge)
Gyunyugayu/Mirukugayu
Gyunyugayu/Mirukugayu

sen.j: 米を牛乳で炊いたもの。
sen.e: This is made by boiling rice in milk.
Made by boiling rice in milk.
Made by boiling rice in milk.

sen.j: 甘くするとライスプディングになる。
sen.e: It becomes rice pudding when it is sweetened.
It becomes rice pudding when it is sweetened.
It becomes rice pudding when it is sweetened.

sen.j: 霰粥（あられがゆ）
sen.e: Araregayu
Araregayu
Araregayu

sen.j: 米の粥の上に出汁を張り、鯛などの魚の切り身を乗せたもの。
sen.e: This dish has dashi broth poured over rice kayu, and it is topped with sliced pieces of fish such as sea bream.
A dish consisting of dashi stock poured over rice kayu, and it is topped with sliced pieces of fish such as sea bream.
A dish consisting of dashi stock poured over rice kayu, and it is topped with sliced pieces of fish such as sea bream.

sen.j: 芋粥（いもがゆ）
sen.e: Imogayu
Imogayu
Imogayu

sen.j: 米の粥にヤマノイモまたはサツマイモを入れて煮た粥。
sen.e: This is a kayu cooked with yams or sweet potatoes in rice kayu.
Made by cooking yam or sweet potato in rice kayu.
Made by cooking yam or sweet potato in rice kayu.

sen.j: カーシャ（ロシア語：Каша）
sen.e: Kasha (Russian: Каша)
Kasha (Russian: Каша)
Kasha (Russian: Каша)

sen.j: エンバク、米、セモリナ、ソバ、キビなどから作るロシアや東ヨーロッパの粥。
sen.e: This is a Russian and Eastern European kayu made from grains such as oats, rice, semolina, buckwheat and millet.
A Russian and Eastern European porridge made from grains such as oats, rice, semolina, buckwheat and millet.
A Russian and Eastern European porridge made from grains such as oats, rice, semolina, buckwheat and millet.

sen.j: ブブル（bubur）
sen.e: Bubur
Bubur
Bubur

sen.j: 白米や黒米で作るマレーシアとインドネシアの粥。
sen.e: This is a Malaysian and Indonesian kayu made with white rice or black rice.
A Malaysian and Indonesian porridge made with white or black rice.
sen.cmt: Deleted "This is""kayu" > "porridge""white rice or black rice" > "white or black rice"
sen.e: A Malaysian and Indonesian porridge made with white or black rice.

sen.j: 米の他に、豆のものもあり、甘いものもある。
sen.e: Besides rice, it can be made with beans, and it can also be sweet.
Besides rice, it can be made with beans, and it can also be sweet.
Besides rice, it can be made with beans, and it can also be sweet.

sen.j: ジョーク、カーオ・トム
sen.e: Johk, Kao Tom
sen.cmt: ジョーク、カーオ・トムの英字表記不明
sen.e: Kao Dom
Joke, Kao Dom
sen.cmt: Joke スペルを変更しました。

sen.j: 卵、ショウガなどで味付けしたタイ王国の米の粥。
sen.e: This is a Thai rice kayu seasoned with eggs and ginger.
A Thai rice porridge seasoned with egg and ginger.
sen.cmt: Reworded to read more naturally and correct terminology.
sen.e: A Thai rice porridge seasoned with egg and ginger.

sen.j: 肉が入ることもある。
sen.e: Sometimes meat is added.
Sometimes meat is added.
Sometimes meat is added.

sen.j: ポリッジ（英語：enPorridge）
sen.e: Porridge
Porridge
Porridge

sen.j: 穀類を水や牛乳などで炊いた粥。
sen.e: This is a kayu made by boiling grains in water or milk.
Made by boiling grains in water or milk.
Made by boiling grains in water or milk.

sen.j: 生クリーム、バター、砂糖などを加えて食べる。
sen.e: It is eaten by adding cream, butter or sugar.
It is eaten by adding cream, butter or sugar.
It is eaten by adding cream, butter or sugar.

sen.j: オートミールとセモリナのポリッジ（クリーム・オブ・ウィート）が最も一般的である。
sen.e: The most common one is the porridge made with oatmeal and semolina (cream of wheat).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The most common variety is made with oatmeal and semolina (cream of wheat).
The most common variety is made with oatmeal and semolina (cream of wheat).

sen.j: その他にコムギ、オオムギ、米、トウモロコシの粉、エンドウマメの粉などもポリッジになる。
sen.e: Additionally, a porridge can also be made with wheat, barley, rice, cornmeal or pea flour.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Porridge can also be made using wheat, barley, rice, cornmeal or peasemeal.
Porridge can also be made using wheat, barley, rice, cornmeal or peasemeal.

sen.j: グリュエル（英語：enGruel）
sen.e: Gruel
Gruel
Gruel

sen.j: ポリッジよりも薄く水だけで炊いた粥または重湯のこと。
sen.e: Thinner than a porridge, this is a kayu made only with water, or it refers to the omoyu.
Thinner than a porridge, it is made using only water and is known as 'omoyu' in Japanese,
sen.cmt: "this is a kayu made only with water" > "it is made using only water"", or it refers to the omoyu" > "and is known as 'omoyu' in Japanese"
sen.e: Thinner than a porridge, it is made using only water and is known as porridge or 'omoyu' in Japanese,
sen.cmt: 粥→porridge を追加しました。

sen.j: ポレンタ(Polenta)
sen.e: Polenta
Polenta
Polenta

sen.j: 粗く挽いたトウモロコシの粉を水またはだし汁に溶き、かきまぜながら煮た北イタリアの粥。
sen.e: This is a northern Italian kayu made by boiling and stirring a mixture of coarsely ground cornmeal and water or broth.
A northern Italian dish made by boiling and stirring a mixture of coarsely ground cornmeal with water or broth.
A northern Italian dish made by boiling and stirring a mixture of coarsely ground cornmeal with water or broth.

sen.j: トウモロコシ粥はクロアチアではジュガンツィ(žganci)、ルーマニアではママリガ(enMămăligă)、北アメリカではマッシュ(enMush (maize)) と呼ばれている。
sen.e: A kayu made of corn is called a žganci in Croatia, a Mămăligă in Romania and a mush in North America.
Maize porridge is known as žganci in Croatia, Mămăligă in Romania and mush in North America.
sen.cmt: "A kayu made of corn is called a" > "Maize porridge is known as"Deleted "a" (x2"
sen.e: Maize porridge is known as žganci in Croatia, Mămăligă in Romania and mush in North America.

sen.j: ウガリ(Ugali)
sen.e: Ugali
Ugali
Ugali

sen.j: トウモロコシやキャッサバの粉から作るアフリカ東部、南部、北部の料理。
sen.e: This is a eastern, southern and northern African dish made with cornmeal or cassava flour.
An eastern, southern and northern African dish made with cornmeal or cassava flour.
An eastern, southern and northern African dish made with cornmeal or cassava flour.

sen.j: 水分が多いと粥状になる。
sen.e: It becomes kayu-like if lots of water is used.
It becomes kayu-like if lots of water is used.
It becomes kayu-like if lots of water is used.

sen.j: パップ(enPap (food))
sen.e: Pap
Pap
Pap

sen.j: トウモロコシの粉などから作る南アフリカの粥。
sen.e: A South African kayu made of cornmeal.
A South African porridge made of cornmeal.
A South African porridge made of cornmeal.

sen.j: アロス・コン・レチェ
sen.e: Arroz con leche
Arroz con Leche
Arroz con Leche

sen.j: 砂糖を入れて甘くしたスペイン語圏の牛乳粥。
sen.e: This is a milk kayu sweetened with sugar in Spanish-speaking countries.
A milk kayu sweetened with sugar in Spanish-speaking countries.
A milk porridge sweetened with sugar in Spanish-speaking countries.

sen.j: 中国の粥と呼び名等
sen.e: Chinese kayu and their names
Names for Chinese Congee
Names for Chinese congee
sen.cmt: congee 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国では全般に用いる「粥（ジョウ）」の他、米のものを「大米粥（ダーミージョウ）」、「稀飯（シーファン）」、「糜（ミー）」なととも呼ぶ。
sen.e: In China, other than 'zhou' used for porridge in general, rice porridge is also called 'da mi zhou,' 'shi fan' or 'mi.'
sen.cmt: ジョウ、ダーミージョウ、シーファン、ミー の英字表記不明
sen.e: In China, the word 'zhou' is used to refer to porridge in general, while rice porridge is known by names including 'da mi zhou,' 'xi fan' or 'mi.'
In China, the word 'zhou' is used to refer to porridge in general, while rice porridge is known by names including 'da mi zhou,' 'xi fan' or 'mi.'

sen.j: 三分粥のような薄いものはスープ扱いで「米湯（ミータン）」、「撩命湯（リャオミンタン）」などと呼ぶ地域もある。
sen.e: There are regions in which thin kayu such as sanbugayu is treated as a soup, and it is called 'mi tan' or 'liao min tan.'
sen.cmt: ミータン、リャオミンタン の英字表記不明
sen.e: There are regions in which thin congee similar to sanbugayu is treated as a soup and called 'mi tang' or 'liao ming tang.'
sen.cmt: Reworded to read more naturally and correct termiology.
sen.e: There are regions in which thin congee similar to sanbugayu is treated as a soup and called 'mi tang' or 'liao ming tang.'

sen.j: 地域によって、どの程度まで煮込むかの違いもある。
sen.e: How long the kayu is cooked differs depending on the region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: How long the congee is cooked for differs depending on the region.
How long the congee is cooked for differs depending on the region.

sen.j: 広東省では半分形が無くなる程度まで煮込むことも多い。
sen.e: In Guandong Province it is often cooked until the grains have lost half of their shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Guandong Province it is often cooked until the grains have lost half of their shape.
In Guangdong Province it is often cooked until the grains have lost half of their shape.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 中華粥の場合、日本の粥より米が原型を残していない場合が多い。
sen.e: In the case of Chinese kayu, often times the rice does not retain its shape compared to Japanese kayu.
It is often the case that the rice in Chinese congee does not retain its shape unlike Japanese kayu.
sen.cmt: Rewritten to read more naturally and use correct terminilogy.
sen.e: It is often the case that the rice in Chinese congee does not retain its shape unlike Japanese kayu.

sen.j: 中華粥（ちゅうかがゆ）
sen.e: Chinese kayu
Chinese Congee
Chinese congee
sen.cmt: congee 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国風の米の粥。
sen.e: Chinese-style rice kayu
Chinese-style rice porridge.
Chinese-style rice porridge.

sen.j: 白粥の他、ニワトリや干し貝柱（茹でたホタテガイやタイラギの貝柱を天日乾燥したもの）などの出汁で炊くことが多い。
sen.e: Besides the shiragayu, it is often cooked in broth made of chicken or dried scallops (boiled scallops or adductor muscles of tairagi shellfish that are sun dried).
In addition to plain congee, it is often cooked in a stock made from chicken or conpoy (the adductor muscles of Japanese scallops or tairagi shellfish that have been boiled and sun-dried)
sen.cmt: Rewritten to read more naturally and use correct terminilogy.
sen.e: In addition to plain congee, it is often cooked in a stock made from chicken or conpoy (the adductor muscles of Japanese scallops or tairagi shellfish that have been boiled and sun-dried)

sen.j: 水分量は五分粥と同程度。
sen.e: The amount of water used is about the same as that of a gobugayu.
The amount of water used is about the same as that used to make Japanese gobugayu.
The amount of water used is about the same as that used to make Japanese gobugayu.

sen.j: 具入りのものも各種あり、魚、カキ (貝)、牛肉、鶏肉、するめ、モヤシ、落花生、皮蛋、鶏卵などさまざまなものを用いる。
sen.e: Many kinds kayu exist, and various ingredients are used such as fish, oysters, beef, chicken, cuttlefish, bean sprouts, peanuts, 100-year old egg (preserved egg) and chicken eggs.
Various ingredients are added to congee including fish, oysters, beef, chicken, cuttlefish, beansprouts, peanuts, century egg (preserved egg) and chicken egg.
sen.cmt: Rewritten to read more naturally and use correct terminilogy.
sen.e: Various ingredients are added to congee including fish, oysters, beef, chicken, cuttlefish, beansprouts, peanuts, century egg (preserved egg) and chicken egg.

sen.j: ショウガやネギを薬味にし、油条を付け合わせとする。
sen.e: Ginger and scallions are used as condiments, and sweetened fried bread twists are used as an accompaniment.
Ginger and spring onions are used as condiments, and you tiao (deep-fried dough) as an accompaniment.
sen.cmt: "scallions" > "spring onions""sweetened fried breas twists" > "you tiao (deep-fried dough)"
sen.e: Ginger and spring onions are used as condiments, and you tiao (deep-fried dough) as an accompaniment.

sen.j: 粟粥（あわがゆ）
sen.e: Awagayu (foxtail millet kayu)
Foxtail Millet Congee
Foxtail millet congee
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国の華北でよく食べられているアワを使った粥。
sen.e: This is a kayu made of foxtail millet that is eaten often in Huabei, China.
A congee made from foxtail millet, and eaten often in Huabei, China.
sen.cmt: "This is a kayu made of" > "A congee made from""that is" > ", and"
sen.e: A congee made from foxtail millet, and eaten often in Huabei, China.

sen.j: 中国語で「小米粥（シャオミージョウ）」などという。
sen.e: It is called 'shao mi zhou' in Chinese.
It is called 'xiao mi zhou' in Chinese.
It is called 'xiao mi zhou' in Chinese.

sen.j: 山西省では、「稀粥」というと粟粥を指し、「稠粥」または「乾粥」というとご飯のように炊いた粟を指す。
sen.e: In Shanxi Province '稀粥' (thin kayu) means awagayu, and '稠粥' (thick kayu) or '乾粥' (dry kayu) refers to millet boiled like rice.
sen.cmt: '稀粥' '稠粥' '乾粥' の英字表記不明
sen.e: In Shanxi Province 'xi zhou' (thin congee) means awagayu, and 'chou zhou' (thick congee) or 'gan zhou' (dry congee) refer to millet that has been boiled like rice.
sen.cmt: "稀粥" > "xi zhou""稠粥" > "chou zhou""乾粥" > "gan zhou""kayu" > "congee" (x3)"refers" > "refer"Added "that has been"
sen.e: In Shanxi Province 'xi zhou' (thin congee) means awagayu, and 'chou zhou' (thick congee) or 'gan zhou' (dry congee) refer to millet that has been boiled like rice.

sen.j: 緑豆粥（りょくとうがゆ）
sen.e: Ryokutogayu (mung bean kayu)
Mung Bean Porridge
Mung bean porridge
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国と朝鮮半島でよく食べられているリョクトウを使った甘くない粥。
sen.e: This is an unsweetened kayu made with mung beans, which is eaten often in China and in the Korean Peninsula.
An unsweetened porridge made with mung beans, which is often eaten in China and the Korean Peninsula.
An unsweetened porridge made with mung beans, which is often eaten in China and the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 中国語で「緑豆粥（リュードウジョウ））」という。
sen.e: In Chinese it is called 'ryudo jo.'
sen.cmt: リュードウジョウの英字表記不明
sen.e: It is called "lu dou zhou" in Chinese.
It is called 'lu dou zhou' in Chinese.

sen.j: 小豆粥（あずきがゆ）
sen.e: Azukigayu
Azuki Bean Porridge
Azuki bean porridge
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国と朝鮮半島で食べられているアズキを使った甘くない粥。
sen.e: This is an unsweetened kayu made with azuki beans, which is eaten often in China and in the Korean Peninsula.
An unsweetened porridge made with azuki beans, which is often eaten in China and the Korean Peninsula.
An unsweetened porridge made with azuki beans, which is often eaten in China and the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 中国語で「紅豆粥（ホンドウジョウ））」、朝鮮語で「パッチュク」（）という。
sen.e: It is called 'hon do jo' in Chinese and 'pap chuk' in Korean.
sen.cmt: ホンドウジョウ、パッチュクの英字表記不明
sen.e: It is called 'hong dou zhou' in Chinese and 'patjuk' in Korean.
It is called 'hong dou zhou' in Chinese and 'patjuk' in Korean.

sen.j: パッチュクには白玉団子が入ることがある。
sen.e: Pap chuk may have shiratama dumplings (Japanese rice flour dumplings) in it.
sen.cmt: パッチュクの英字表記不明
sen.e: Rice flour dumplings are sometimes added to patjuk.
sen.cmt: Corrected terminology and rewrote to read more naturally.
sen.e: Rice flour dumplings are sometimes added to patjuk.

sen.j: 八宝粥（はっぽうがゆ）
sen.e: Happogayu (eight treasure congee)
Ba Bao Zhou (Eight Treasure Congee)
Ba Bao Zhou (Eight treasure congee)
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国で一般的な、米の粥に豆類、ナツメなど8種類の材料を加えた、甘い粥。
sen.e: This is a sweet kayu common in China, which is made by adding eight kinds of ingredients such as beans and nuts to a rice kayu.
A sweet dish common in China, which is made by adding eight ingredients such as beans and jujube to a rice congee.
sen.cmt: Deleted "This is""kayu" > "porridge"Deleted "kinds of""nuts" > "jujube""a rice kayu" > "rice congee"
sen.e: A sweet dish common in China, which is made by adding eight ingredients such as beans and jujube to a rice congee.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 七草粥（ななくさがゆ）
sen.e: Nanakusagayu (kayu with seven herbs)
Nanakusagayu (Kayu with Seven Herbs)
Nanakusagayu (Kayu with seven herbs)
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 芹（セリ）、薺（ナズナ）、御形（ゴギョウ）、繁縷（ハコベ）、仏の座（ほとけのざ、コオニタビラコ）、菘（すずな、カブ）、蘿蔔（すずしろ、ダイコン）の7種類の野草（春の七草）茹でて刻み、米の粥に混ぜ込んだもの。
sen.e: This is a dish made with seven kinds of plants (the seven herbs of spring), which are seri (dropwort), nazuna (shepherd's purse), gogyo (cudweed), hakobe (chickweed), hotoke no za (henbit), suzuna (turnip) and suzushiro (daikon radish), that are boiled, chopped and mixed into a rice kayu.

A dish made with seven herbs (the seven herbs of spring), which are seri (Japanese parsley), nazuna (shepherd's purse), gogyo (Jersey cudweed), hakobe (common chickweed), hotoke no za (henbit), suzuna (turnip) and suzushiro (daikon), that are boiled, chopped and mixed into a rice kayu.

A dish made with seven herbs (the seven herbs of spring), which are seri (Japanese parsley), nazuna (shepherd's purse), gogyo (Jersey cudweed), hakobe (common chickweed), hotoke no za (henbit), suzuna (turnip) and suzushiro (daikon), that are boiled, chopped and mixed into a rice kayu.

sen.j: 1月7日に食べる習慣がある。
sen.e: It is customary to eat it on January 7th.
It is customarily eaten on January 7th.
It is customarily eaten on January 7.

sen.j: 小豆粥（あずきがゆ）
sen.e: Azukigayu
Azukigayu (Azuki Bean Kayu)
Azukigayu (Azuki bean kayu)
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 別名桜粥（さくらがゆ）。
sen.e: This is also known as sakuragayu.
Also known as sakuragayu.
Also known as sakuragayu.

sen.j: 柔らかく煮た小豆を米とともに炊き込んだもの。
sen.e: This is a dish made with azuki beans, cooked until soft, boiled together with rice.
Made with azuki beans, which have been cooked until soft, boiled with rice.
Made with azuki beans, which have been cooked until soft, boiled with rice.

sen.j: 小正月（1月15日）に食べる習慣がある。
sen.e: It is customary to eat it at Koshogatsu (little New Year) (January 15th).
It is customarily eaten during Koshogatsu (little New Year) (January 15th).
sen.cmt: "customary to eat it on" > "customarily eaten during"
sen.e: It is customarily eaten during Koshogatsu (little New Year) (January 15).

sen.j: 小正月に食べる場合は鏡開きをした餅をいれる。
sen.e: When it is eaten on Koshogatsu, mochi (rice cake) pieces from Kagamibiraki (the custom of cutting and eating a large, round rice cake, which had been offered to the gods at New Year's, on January 11) are added.
When it is eaten on Koshogatsu, mochi (rice cake) pieces from kagamibiraki (the custom of cutting the New Year's rice cake on January 11th) are added.
When it is eaten on Koshogatsu, mochi (rice cake) pieces from kagamibiraki (the custom of cutting the New Year's rice cake on January 11) are added.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島の小豆粥パッチュクは冬至に食べる。
sen.e: Pap chuk, the azukigayu of the Korean Peninsula, is eaten at winter solstice.
The patjuk azuki bean porridge of the Korean Peninsula is eaten during the winter solstice.
The patjuk azuki bean porridge of the Korean Peninsula is eaten during the winter solstice.

sen.j: 臘八粥（ろうはちがゆ）
sen.e: Rohachigayu
La Ba Zhou (Laba Congee)
La Ba Zhou (Laba congee)
sen.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 中国で、12月8日 (旧暦)に食べる、米、豆、クリ、ナツメ、ナッツなどの具入りの粥。
sen.e: Eaten in China on December 8th (lunar calendar), this is a kayu with ingredients such as rice, beans, chestnuts, jujube and nuts.
Eaten in China on December 8th (lunar calendar), this is a congee containing ingredients such as rice, beans, chestnuts, jujube and nuts.
Eaten in China on December 8 (lunar calendar), this is a congee containing ingredients such as rice, beans, chestnuts, jujube and nuts.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。日本のお粥ではないため、Kayu →porridge にしました。

sen.j: 粥鍋（粥底火鍋 チョッダイフォーウォー）

sen.j: 広東省の順徳料理の名物。
sen.e: It is a specialty of juntoku cuisine in Guandong Province.
A specialty of Shunde, Guangdong Province.
A specialty of Shunde, Guangdong Province.

sen.j: 出汁ではなく、粥の中に各種の具を入れて、煮ながら食べる寄せ鍋。
sen.e: This is a hot pot dish in which various ingredients are added to a pot of porridge instead of broth, cooked and eaten.
A hot pot dish in which various ingredients are added to a pot of porridge instead of stock, cooked and eaten.
A hot pot dish in which various ingredients are added to a pot of porridge instead of stock, cooked and eaten.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

There are various types of kayu available in vacuum packs.

This is an instant food item from which kayu is made by adding hot water.
This is an instant food item from which kayu is made by adding hot water.
